page.title: 04Farming
page.content: Our countryside has a pattern of small family farms, some smallholdings and cottages with a bit of land attached, with a preponderance of pasture, old orchards with cattle grazing under the trees and fields used for hay, silage and barley. Of the 26 juniors in the school, 10 live on farms and most of them play an active part in the working life. In our survey of resident adults' jobs, the number of farmers far outweighed all other categories put together and a large number of "housewives" helped on their family farms. Very nearly all of the farmers' wives in the area work extensively on their holdings. There are some sheep which are kept mainly in fields along Walmore Hill and other local rises. In the dips, the cattle graze under apple and plum trees. Both dairy and beef cattle are kept.
